1.question: In Fig. 1, what is the primary goal of using contrastive PCA (cPCA) as compared to standard PCA?

options.A: To detect clusters in the background data.
options.B: To minimize variance in the target data.
options.C: To identify directions with higher variance in the target data compared to the background.
options.D: To combine multiple datasets into a single projection.
options.E: To maximize variance in both target and background data.

options.B: Data points are in a single cluster.

options.D: It combines all mice into a single cluster.

options.A: All data from different regions overlap.
